meanings.definition: To separate or disentangle things that have been mixed together.
meanings.sent1: I carefully unmingle the different colored beads in the box.
meanings.sent2: She used a fork to unmingle the spaghetti noodles before serving.
meanings.sent3: Trying to unmingle the tangled headphones always feels like solving a puzzle.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter seemed to unmingle the tension in the room.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to unmingle the intertwined rings with a flick of his wrist.

meanings.definition: To remove or separate oneself from a group or situation.
meanings.sent1: He decided to unmingle from the noisy party and take a walk outside.
meanings.sent2: The shy student tends to unmingle from group activities during recess.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to unmingle from the group of dogs chasing it.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to unmingle from the toxic relationship was a brave step towards self-care.
meanings.sent5: The explorer had to unmingle from the dense forest to find his way back to camp.
